 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גַּו‎</span>] **noun masculine** ==midst== (Egyptian Aramaic, Nabataean, Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גו‎</span>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גָּיו‎</span>; especially construct <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בְּגוֺ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְגוֺ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִגּוֺ‎</span>; so Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; compare Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נֵּו‎</span>); — construct <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גּוֺא‎</span> (so Nabataen [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>No. 94</sup>) [[Dan.3.26|Dan 3:26]] +, [[Dan.7.15|Dan 7:15]] editions, [[BDB#Gi|Gi]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גּוֺ‎</span> ([[BDB#Baer|Baer]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גּוֺא‎</span>, see on [[Dan.3.6|Dan 3:6]]); suffix 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גַּוֵּהּ‎</span> [[Ezra.5.7|Ezra 5:7]], 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גַּוַּהּ‎</span> [[Ezra.4.15|Ezra 4:15]]; [[Ezra.6.2|Ezra 6:2]] — ***midst***, always with prepositions: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בְּגוֺא‎</span> (= Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּתוֺךְ‎</span>), [[Dan.3.25|Dan 3:25]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בְּגוֺא גוּרָא‎</span>, [[Dan.4.7|Dan 4:7]]; [[Dan.7.15|Dan 7:15]]; [[Ezra.4.15|Ezra 4:15]]; [[Ezra.5.7|Ezra 5:7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וְכִדְנָה כְּתִיב בְּגַוֵהּ‎</span>, [[Ezra.6.2|Ezra 6:2]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְגוֺא‎</span> [[Dan.3.6|Dan 3:6]]; [[Dan.3.11|Dan 3:11]]; [[Dan.3.15|Dan 3:15]]; [[Dan.3.21|Dan 3:21]]; [[Dan.3.23|Dan 3:23]]; [[Dan.3.24|Dan 3:24]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןגּֿוֺא‎</span> [[Dan.3.26|Dan 3:26]]. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גֵּרָה‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גאה‎</span>.
